snippet: Julia Bluhm, an eighth grader from Maine, petitioned Seventeen magazine to feature unaltered photos, to give girls more reasonable body images.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on Maine eighth grader Julia Bluhm, who has personally delivered a 46,000-signature petition to Seventeen magazine, asking it to feature unaltered photos of 'real girls,' showing normal body types and skin problems; Bluhm is leading a national fight through her blog Spark against the destructive misrepresentation of beauty in media.
lead_paragraph: Julia Bluhm, an eighth grader from Maine, petitioned Seventeen magazine to feature unaltered photos, to give girls more reasonable body images.

headline.print_headline: A Real Girl, 14, Takes a Stand Against the Flawless Faces in Magazines
headline.seo: Seventeen Magazine Faulted by Girl, 14, for Doctoring Photos
headline.main: A Real Girl, 14, Takes a Stand Against the Flawless Faces in Magazines
